description: If you work with SVGs at all, they should go through this editor at least once during the process of editing or creating them. It has great support for the most advanced elements of the SVG standard and doesn't hide the code behind abstraction. The markup is easily visible and editable.
Good choice for simple svg image

Our Eval : 
* Constantly stops working, can't move or pan background.
* The grid system sucks badly !
Just doesn't work consistantly !

~ But would be awesome if it worked.
Lately I've just been playing with some SVG drawing tools. This one at the same time looks simple, but offers you plenty of tools!
From time to time the Gnome software store recommends some gems

As someone who has Inkscape installed on my system, but never use it because it's interface is very scary, I found Boxy SVG's to be quite accessible and intuitive for an absolute beginner like me. Combine the clean interface with some really good online Youtube tutorials that you can access from the Help menu, and you can get up and going pretty quickly. I can't say how more experienced users will regard this program, but it's definitely not a toy. Give it a shot, because this is the kind of program that should be featured in the Snap Store.
Excellent. Easy to use and loads of features.
summary: Excellent. Easy to use and loads of features

description: This program works great! However, for a simpler and handier SVG editor, you can use mBlock's sprite editor at: ide.mblock.cc
summary: Very good SVG editor nd maker!

description: User friendly. Clean and intuitive interface
Printers are not detected. Print to file only.
